lj.lj_ly: sold the merchandise at a loss.
I am at a loss to understand those remarks.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English los 'destruction', of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse los 'breaking up of the ranks of an army' and loose; later probably a back-formation from lost, past participle of lose

entry.def: Loss is the fact of no longer having something or having less of it than before.

example.ex: The loss of income for the government is about $250 million a month.
example.tran: 政府收入每月大概减少2.5亿美元。

entry.def: Loss of life occurs when people die.

example.ex: The allies suffered less than 20 casualties while enemy losses were said to be high.
example.tran: 盟军伤亡人数不到20，而敌军则据说人员损失惨重。

entry.tran: （亲人或朋友的）丧故，亡故，逝世
entry.def: The loss of a relative or friend is their death.

example.ex: They took the time to talk about the loss of Thomas and how their grief was affecting them.
example.tran: 他们慢慢谈到了托马斯的死和悲痛给他们带来的影响。

entry.def: If a business makes a loss, it earns less than it spends.

example.ex: In 1986 Rover made a loss of nine hundred million pounds...
The company said it will stop producing fertilizer in 1990 because of continued losses.
example.tran: 由于持续亏损，该公司说它将在1990年停止生产化肥。

entry.def: Loss is the feeling of sadness you experience when someone or something you like is taken away from you.

example.ex: Talk to others about your feelings of loss and grief...
example.tran: 把自己的失落和悲伤向他人倾诉。

example.ex: He always woke with a sense of deep sorrow and depressing loss.
example.tran: 他醒来时总是满怀哀愁，抑郁惆怅。

entry.def: A loss is the disadvantage you suffer when a valuable and useful person or thing leaves or is taken away.

example.ex: She said his death was a great loss to herself.
example.tran: 她说他的死对自己来说是巨大的损失。

entry.tran: （热量、血液、液体等的）流失，散失，减少
entry.def: The loss of something such as heat, blood, or fluid is the gradual reduction of it or of its level in a system or in someone's body.
If a business produces something at a loss, they sell it at a price which is less than it cost them to produce it or buy it.

example.ex: New fashion designs have to be sold off at a loss if sales are poor.
example.tran: 新款时装遇上销路不畅就要蚀本卖出。

entry.tran: 茫然不知所措；不知如何是好
entry.def: If you say that you are at a loss, you mean that you do not know what to do in a particular situation.

example.ex: I was at a loss for what to do next...
example.tran: 下一步该怎么做，我完全没谱。

example.ex: The government is at a loss to know how to tackle the violence.
example.tran: 对于如何应对暴力问题，政府现在一筹莫展。

entry.def: If you cut your losses, you stop doing what you were doing in order to prevent the bad situation that you are in becoming worse.

example.ex: Directors are right to cut their losses, admit they chose the wrong man and make a change.
example.tran: 董事们当断则断，承认自己选错了人，并且作了人员变更，这样做是正确的。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a dead loss, you have a low opinion of them because you think they are completely useless or unsuccessful.

example.ex: I'd had no experience of organizing anything of that sort. I think I was largely a dead loss.
example.tran: 筹办那类活动我毫无经验。我看我基本是个废物。

sentences.sentence: "everyone expected him to win so his loss was a shock"
"loss of livestock left the rancher bankrupt"

means.word_mean: 3. the amount by which the cost of a business exceeds its revenue;

sentences.sentence: "the company operated at a loss last year"
"the company operated in the red last year"

means.word_mean: 4. gradual decline in amount or activity;
5. the disadvantage that results from losing something;

sentences.sentence: "his loss of credibility led to his resignation"

means.word_mean: 6. military personnel lost by death or capture
7. the experience of losing a loved one;

sentences.sentence: "he sympathized on the loss of their grandfather"

auth_sentence.content: It is no big loss when superfluous things disappear.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is no big loss when superfluous things disappear.

Sentence.sentence: Today, given the job losses of the past year, fewer unhappy couples will risk starting separate households, Furthermore, the housing market meltdown will make it more difficult for them to finance their separations by selling their homes.

Global warming is causing more than 300,000 deaths and about $125 billion in economic losses each year, according to a report by the Global Humanitarian Forum, an organization led by Annan, the former United Nations secretary general.

a political scientist at the University of Colorado, Boulder, who studies disaster trends, said the Forum's report was "a methodological embarrassment" because there was no way to distinguish deaths or economic losses related to human-driven global warming amid the much larger losses resulting from the growth in populations and economic development in vulnerable (易受伤害的) regions.
A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression.
By contrast, the loss in household wealth between December 2007 and December 2008 was 17%
They suffer great losses in stocks, property and other assets.

sentences.en: You should ensure yourself against loss of heat by having double glazing.
sentences.cn: 你应该装双层玻璃防止热量散失。

sentences.en: The oversight issued in heavy loss.
sentences.cn: 这次疏忽造成重大损耗。

means.word_mean: （某人离开或珍贵物品被取走造成的）损失；因离去而造成损失者

sentences.en: My losses are nothing to yours.
sentences.cn: 我的损失和你的比起来算不了什么。

jushi.english: My brother and I are responsible for the loss.
jushi.chinese: 我和我弟弟对这次损失负责。

jushi.english: Blindness is the loss of the sensation of sight.
